Private Litigation Case Title: Sarah Moore v. Ulta Salon Cosmetics & Fragrance Inc et al
Quinby et al v. Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance, Inc.
Lee v. Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance, Inc.

Info Source: Contained in data obtained on May 23, 2018 in response to a Freedom of Information Act request.

Company: Ulta Salon, Cosmetics and Fragrance, Inc.
Description: Ulta agreed to pay $175,000 to the District Attorneys of Monterey and Riverside counties to resolve allegations about price scanner violations.

Company: ULTA Salon Cosmetics and Fragrance Inc.
Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 44612: Cosmetics, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores
Info Source: February 7, 2020 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Tellez v. Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance, Inc. et al

Description: Ulta Beauty, Inc., Ulta Salon, Cosmetics & Fragrance, Inc., Ulta, Inc., and Possibilities AB, Inc. agreed to pay a total of $752,000 of civil penalties, supplemental environmental projects, and costs in settlement of allegations by 34 California District Attorneys and City Attorneys that the companies failed to follow hazardous waste regulations  by improper storage, handling, and disposal of hazardous and other regulated waste and inadequate employee training.

NAICS Translation: 446120: Cosmetics, Beauty Supplies, and Perfume Stores
